posts.title: Designing with Bento Grids
posts.excerpt: Why modular, asymmetric grids make interfaces feel organized, alive, and memorable.
posts.contentHtml:
Interactive elements—buttons, sliders, cards, and device mockups—guide users through an experience. Used well, they make a site feel responsive and intentional. A bento grid assembles diverse elements—logo, typography, notifications, and vivid imagery—into a clean, coherent layout.

This article shows how to structure a flexible grid and layer in motion responsibly.

posts.title: Notes: Practical Bento Tips
posts.excerpt: Quick wins for accessible, responsive bento tiles.
posts.contentHtml:
• Use grid-auto-rows with minmax() to keep rhythm.
  • Add :focus-visible styles for keyboard users.
  • Respect prefers-reduced-motion in animations.
